newsitem.title: VATICAN: Text of Pope's medical bulletin.
newsitem.headline: Text of Pope's medical bulletin.

text.p: The following is the Vatican's English translation of the medical bulletin issued after Pope John Paul's appendix surgery on Tuesday.
The bulletin was signed by a six-strong medical team including chief surgeon Francesco Crucitti and the Pope's personal physician, Renato Buzzonetti.

"According to the schedule previously communicated on September 14, this morning, October 8, 1996, the Holy Father underwent - under a general anaesthesia - the surgical procedure of an appendectomy, previous to which there was a lysis (dissolving) of localised adhesions.
The operation confirmed the clinical diagnosis of recurring episodes of inflammation of the appendix as previously stated.

The extemporaneous histological examination showed a transmural appendicitis with evidence of fibrosis established from preceding inflammatory episodes. The morphological finding is indicative of recidivist appendicitis.
The exam will be completed with the usual definitive histopathological research.
The operation began at 7:50 a.m. and ended at 8:40 a.m. and was undergone well by the patient.
The vital signs: cardio-circulatory, respiratory, hematological and metabolical stayed with the norm for the entire duration of the operation.
Immediately following the surgery, the Holy Father was taken back to his room...
The next up-dating on the post-operative period of the Holy Father will be given through press communiques, the first of which will be made public Wednesday, October 9, at 12 noon (1000 GMT)."
